page.title: 07Farmer's Year
page.content: Lambing time starts the farmer's year in January and goes on until March. In April the job is to look after the ewes and the lambs. This is also the time for getting ready for silage time. The pit has to be cleaned out and all the machinery serviced. June sees the start of silage time, the tractors go out into the fields with mowers and choppers and the cut grass is brought back and put in the pit and squashed down so all the air is squeezed out. Next some hay is made, with this the grass is allowed to dry before it is brought into the barn. Some farmers manage to get a second silage crop in late summer. The time has now come to dip the sheep and prepare for the sheep sales. Soon the year will be over and the cycle will start again.
